column3:
Automatic sanity-testing: FAILED MERGE, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/e1a36eefea413f83f91da3f4ffdbb0182f45587e for test log.

This pull does not merge cleanly onto current master

Is this functionality currently safe enough to trigger automatically? What will happen in these cases:

1) Client stops before full import completes

2) User exits (after succesful import), then re-starts bitcoin

Also, we probably want some kind of progress widget, as the process can take a few hours.
Right now, Bitcoin-Qt is fully interactive during IBD...\n

@luke-jr So to decode that, you mean run this importing in a thread (after the Init succeeds), pretend that the blocks come in from the network, and use the current progress mechanism? I suppose that could work, if you block the real network for the duration that the file is being read.\n\nAlso it doesn't address the above points. Does it somehow need to remember where it was with importing, betwe

I recently added an info message when doing a -loadblock, so this needs a rebase + the shorter the message the better, because of the small splashscreen.

@luke-jr When doing a -loadblock nothing is interactive, the client is just displaying the splashscreen and a message for ~1 hour or more.
@laanwj I guess that would keep the current IBD behaviour during a loadblocks. However, it seems like it has potential to slow things down, so should probably be tested.\n

It should not be used for the specific -loadblocks, which is also a benchmark. 

But for the automatic loadblocks for bootstrapping users (that jgarzik is proposing) it'd be fine. It's fine if it is a bit slower as long as the user gets feedback and doesn't have the idea that his client crashed at the splash screen.
So perhaps rebase and change the second InitMessage to `Auto-Importing blocks...`?\n

I'm planning on writing a "reindexer" that takes an existing blk*.dat file (in the normal location for those), and rebuilds/updates the index with the found blocks, and afterwards reorg to a new best chain if one is found there. That's maybe even preferable?\n
Yes, a reindexer would absolutely be preferred.  Should be faster, with less disk traffic, and no files left over at the end.\n

A better way to reindex would be great, I already did some code for this (loading a blk?.dat files with a progress gui) in the leveldb branch but it's not very good because I wanted the change as small as possible.\n
Am I misunderstanding this patch?  It looks like it will reimport at every startup because it doesn't remove/move/flag the file when done. That seems pretty surprising.\n
Yes, I thought so. That's why I asked what would happen in those cases. \n

Rebased, and corrected the FMB (frequently mentioned bug):  it now renames bootstrap.dat, after import, to prevent re-import.

That should address all outstanding objections.
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/25b5d5da7daf046c974bb32785bb58f877d46795 for binaries and test log.\n
Updated strings, addressing @Diapolo's comments.\n

@jgarzik Thanks, one last nitpick, we use ellipsis for every stage of the init and you make me happy, when you convert the `.` into `...` for both strings :-D. You are free to hate me a little afterwards ^^, but get my ACK then.\n

ACK.

(and  I think Diapolo's nit-picking is excessive)
@gavinandresen I sometimes hate that character trait and so I'm fine with other devs ignoring some of the nit-picks if they feel bugged.\n

Can you please remove that double-space, it really sucks on Transifex to have these, thanks :).
Same for the second string below...

Edit: And as that message is quite large it will perhaps not even fit in our tiny splashscreen.
